messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] For Tia
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh I agree with you there. ... I still don t see what s wrong with people doing things to make money, even if they don t need it.  In other words, I d
messages.messageBody:
>Tia,
>What I meant by for profit wasn't that there shouldn't be any profit
>at all. I just don't like how the logging companies strip the land.

Oh I agree with you there.


>Also the 5 forests I know of are owned by 3 neighbors. They chose to
>strip the land for money. Not b/c of hardships but because they
>wanted new things. A new yacht. A huge new house. Other examples.
>With no regard to the land or animals.

I still don't see what's wrong with people doing things to make money, even
if they don't "need" it. In other words, I'd have a problem with
clear-cutting even if the owner needed the money because of hardship. I
prefer the native attitude toward land, in the sense of it being our
responsibility to care for it rather than wreck it.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: For Tia
messages.msgSnippet: Tia, What I meant by for profit wasn t that there shouldn t be any profit at all.  I just don t like how the logging companies strip the land. Also the 5
messages.messageBody:
Tia,
What I meant by for profit wasn't that there shouldn't be any profit
at all. I just don't like how the logging companies strip the land.

Also the 5 forests I know of are owned by 3 neighbors. They chose to
strip the land for money. Not b/c of hardships but because they
wanted new things. A new yacht. A huge new house. Other examples.
With no regard to the land or animals.

That is what makes me sick.
inmdcrew
